abstract: Michele Norris will leave NPR's All Things Considered for a year since her husband is joining President Obama's re-election campaign.
snippet: Michele Norris will leave NPR's All Things Considered for a year since her husband is joining President Obama's re-election campaign.
lead_paragraph: Brian Stelter reports on The Times's Media Decoder blog that Michele Norris, the co-host of the flagship NPR news program "All Things Considered," will leave that position for a year, she said Monday, because her husband, Broderick Johnson, is joining President Obama's re-election campaign.

headline.main: Obama Campaign's Gain Is NPR's Loss
